body_html: Thank you for your contribution! In general we encourage users with nonstandard setup to build their own pip packages from source. And we are specifically encouraging the CUDA 7 runtime with CUDNN 6.5 because it's one less variable to consider when debugging (and this is the version we use and test with). Since it doesn't seem like there's any issue, I'm closing / archiving this for now.
body_text: Thank you for your contribution!  In general we encourage users with nonstandard setup to build their own pip packages from source.  And we are specifically encouraging the CUDA 7 runtime with CUDNN 6.5 because it's one less variable to consider when debugging (and this is the version we use and test with).  Since it doesn't seem like there's any issue, I'm closing / archiving this for now.
body: Thank you for your contribution!  In general we encourage users with nonstandard setup to build their own pip packages from source.  And we are specifically encouraging the CUDA 7 runtime with CUDNN 6.5 because it's one less variable to consider when debugging (and this is the version we use and test with).  Since it doesn't seem like there's any issue, I'm closing / archiving this for now.
